intro: Salpinga fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered spike-vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Salpinga fasciculata is typically found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
